Look, overall, the game and port ARE 5 stars worthy. Totally fleshed out game, lots of dialogue options, interesting location, and I'm playing on an Amazon tablet where I had to separately download the Google apk and zero bugs. So, it's got everything that should make me want to give 5 stars... But, I actually find myself hating the actual game. I love baldurs gate, but I find i really didn't love this game. I think there are several reasons why I liked one and not the other: I like making my own characters in rpg games. i don't mind if they have backstories, but I NEED the character to otherwise be my own in an RPG. See, making my own character makes me interested in knowing other characters/world bc I now have a somewhat vested interest in the "wellbeing" of my character. But, you're stuck as a male human, I could give two poops about having the option to change my class, that doesn't interest me. SO, where normally I love dialogue in games, I absolutely hated it in this game where the vast majority of the game takes place in dialogue bc I did NOT like my character. Seriously, there's a dungeon or two with respawning monsters just bc there is so little actual combat.
